intro: Arabis axillaris, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed or dissected, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Arabis axillaris is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
